intro: Chorizema gomphocarpum, commonly known as the sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant has small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, and its leaves are typically narrow and fleshy. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Chorizema gomphocarpum plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small organisms.
